posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I like both of these rapscallions, but can't help scratching my poor fat head a little. Both Lawful? Are we sure? Maybe their murky backstories would help? Maybe the dwarf's company of DwDs were betrayed by their less than scrupulous king and he's the only one left alive. He blames himself and has taken to the bottle and become more bristly in his outlook. And the once noble Half-Orc, sent to the monastery as the pride of his clan, returned after his training to find Oubold-Many-Arrows had paid them a visit, and his naturally barbaric nature began to take hold before he fully remembered he was now a paragon of virtue for his kind.

Or some such bollocks.

Anyway, I like the builds!

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content: Chaos/Law alignment restrictions suck.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Oh, I agree. I always liked my tales of Robin Hood as a lad, and reckoned Friar Tuck would be a great Bard/Monk/DwD (yes, I know, dramatic license with the Dwarf). Still, that's life (well, you know what I mean). I suppose I can understand it if I try to look at things with a "that would be way too OP, it needs chaining," head on. I try, honestly.

While we're on whinges, I've two more bugbears with NwN. Both are well-rehearsed elsewhere, but I'll bring them out of the closet again for another airing. First, there is no good reason for Assassin to be evil (no pun intended). Neutral, maybe, but evil is a choice. Would assassinating *pick-dictator-of-choice* be evil? Second, why the bloody hell do Elves have Wizard as their favoured class? Not even any old spell-chucker, but Wizard? Surely Ranger makes more sense?

Anyway, that's my rant done for this month. And I do still bite the bullet and play by the rules - it's still the best game in town, after all.

Cheers

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content: Haha assasin alignment is a running joke at our table, along with bard. As for rules, I had a chuckle about Hip's gnash your teeth sermon because in both PnP and NWN the rules can be easily changed... That's why we have modules and PWs. The base game has plenty to be improved on.
